page.title: 03The University of Surrey
page.content: The University is situated on a landslip at the base of Stag Hill. It is for people of the ages from 18 years to 22 years. The specialities are engineering, science and human studies. In the 200 acres of land there are houses for the students,a bank,a huge{library,}restaurants and sport facilities..The library is very large,so it has a computer to help find the book which you want. The University was granted its charter in 1966 and was formed from Battersea Polytechnic Institute. An important feature is the {"industrial year",}where students spend a year in industry, commerce or other appropriate field in this country or abroad, to gain experience. Working on 1981/1982 figures, there are 2830 first degree students, 695 postgraduates and 379 acedemic staff.
